There's more to this bakery than meets the eye - no seriously, I couldn't believe how big the place was - and no matter what you order, you'll leave happy!

Can't go wrong with this place. We've been here a few times and I always get the same thing (small chocolate ice cream in a cone) but now that I'm reading other reviews, i NEED to switch it up and try something else. Plenty of parking for this sweet little place.

I read about this place on The Pioneer Woman blog, and when Peter and I planned a visit to Ikea we decided to make a stop. We split a Croque Monsier. It was tasty, but next time we come here (the will be a next time for sure!) I'd probably try something else, or skip lunch altogether and just pick up some dessert. We got quite a selection of baked goods, and would order most again. We had some macarons and a salted caramel brownie at the actual restaurant. We both loved the pistachio, but the orange and lemon tasted a little bit like Fruit Loops and seemed stale compared to the pistachio. We took home a box full of goodies (another brownie, an eclair, a chocolate croissant, two more macarons, and a petit four) that we ate over the next couple of days. All were delicious. Peter said the eclair was exactly what an eclair should be. My favorite was the salted caramel brownie, it was heaven. I am a sucker for anything salty, especially sweet and salty, so this is no surprise. It was totally worth a stop, but I wouldn't make a special trip to Charlotte just to eat here.
Great drink and dessert options. Opened 24 hours which makes it a nice place get work done. Finding a good spot can get tricky at times. Still, it's always an experience when I come here.

Being from Youngstown, I was thrilled when I heard Handel's was opening in Las Vegas...and a mere two blocks from my house. The new location reminds me of the ones in Y'town....walk-up windows, no seating....great ice cream. Some are a little richer or sweeter than I'd like (choc. peanut butter and chocolate raspberry truffle), so I stick with chocolate malt w caramel, banana creme pie, chocolate pecan, or chocolate marshmallow. The only two downsides: the walk-up and the wait. That said, that's how it is in Youngstown, so why expect different here?

Now I know where to come to get gelato, if we haven't churned any ice cream at home. The girl at the counter was very sweet with C and patent with him. Had I let him, he would have wanted to try all the flavors. Lol Their flavors are outstanding. Favorites bring cinnamon toast crunch, captain crunch, and whiskey Irish cream. Now if only we can replicate those flavors at home, ice cream life would be amazing. Lol

Suggested to us by a security guard, a couple blocks of The Fremont Street Experience. You see the picture, delectable. A little pricey, but it is Vegas.... Well worth every penny. Don't often crave a donut, bit glad I did today. Walking distance, close to hotel, perfect. Well worth your text and Penny's, priceless!!!!
Love this place, cool options and good options for those not too adventurous. Tasty ice cream so fresh and I had the coffee float with sesame ice cream DELICIOUS!

We don't have many Italian bakeries in Charlotte, so this place is a dessert-heaven sent! Do not leave here without getting one of their massive chocolate croissants (i know those are French and not Italian but my oh my!!)! If you're looking for a cake, the Italian Wedding Cake is marvelous. You can get cake by the slice or order an entire one to take home -- they've got a ton of flavors to choose from! I also love the pastries, like the turnovers and chocolate croissants (they're packed with so much chocolate and are so flaky). I'm a cannoli connoisseur, so I do have to say that I'm not a fan of their cannoli; the cream is a little thick and not as silky as I like a typical filling to be. But the bakery offers so many other tasty treats that I can't knock them on their cannoli alone. They're well staffed and very attentive to their customers. They're situated off the road with a huge gravel parking lot, so you don't have to worry about trying to find a space -- pick up is easy.

If you're a donuts fan, this is a must-stop shop during your trip to Vegas! You'll be surprised how big half of their donuts are! Yes, you'll also want to order one just to see if it's possible to finish one. Plus, they have very appealing regular sized donuts, so you may as well order one of those as well! I am also curious if the fish tank has real donuts at the bottom or fake ones - that was the hot debate in our group. I still say no way those were real! Bonus tip, use the restroom before you leave for the wall art!
The donuts were awesome! Great there early the sell out fast We got the nutella donut it was amazing
Spent $18 on 2 dry tasteless cookies and 2 Brownies that we're dry and old- very disappointing! Don't waste your $$

Having heard so much about it, and being a complete sugar-head, I REALLY wanted to like this place. It's open 24 hours and the caramel salted brownie is quite good. But, after 3 visits, I have tried several pastries and cakes and they are just ok at best and at worst kind of tasteless and spongy/heavy. The desserts are chilled and for some of them it makes them worse for the wear-- such as anything that is supposed to be flaky. Cute decor does not make up for mediocre sweets. I have yet to try their lunch/breakfast offerings, so maybe this is what keeps other reviewers so enthused.
This place is amazing! Their strawberry shortcake was the best I've had in a very long time!!
Great delicious flavors of ice cream. And can try a bunch in a sample muffin pan dish!

My sisters were not impressed with the crack pie at all . It is extremely sweet but nothing special. Taste like raw Dough. Just tasted like sugar Cookies taste better but they aren't that great either It wasn't amazing but it was dry !!!! Milkshake was good. Coffee is good to me cold brewed but some people aren't into the sour taste . Overall, a spot that doesn't hit the spot as much as you have expected

I had the mint chocolate chip sundae!! I words can't describe! It was amazing and very satisfying. It was so good!! And the chocolate chip cookie was very good as well. It was thick and buttery - melted in your mouth!

I've been here twice now and I have to say, Churn is delicious. I had Vietnamese Coffee and the Carrot Cheesecake ice cream and I was not disappointed. I think the Vietnamese Coffee ice cream is the best ice coffee ice cream I've ever had! They used condensed milk and espresso. They also give you an option to add toasted marshmallow fluff, which is absolutely perfect for anyone with a sweet tooth. I am sensitive to anything that is too sweet, so I stuck to a single scoop for $2.75. This place is a must try. They are open till 10pm on Sundays, which is later than other places around.

Sometimes when you go to these places that are highly reviewed or have a lot of publicity, you have a small letdown. But honestly I having eaten a lot of ice cream in my day and it was the best Sunday I've ever had. I will be back.
Delicious doughnuts, great menu that changes all the time. Better than most donuts I've tried. Friendly staff too.

I totally love that you get your custard and then sit out on the picnic tables. It is as close to "the good old days" as it gets anymore. I really like that you can add banana to anything too! And I've gotten my kids the Teddy Bear Custard Cup a couple of times, its cute. They love it and its pretty cheap. Its just a regular cup of custard with like 5 teddy grahams stuck in the custard and you can add banana or nuts or whatever.

On the Las Vegas Strip, The Linq Walkway filled with stores, restaurants, and fun things to do in Las Vegas. The High Roller Wheel is located towards the end of the Linq Walkway depending on which entrance you enter. It is right next to the parking lot. They have fun restaurants like Sushi Burrito, Gordon Ramsey Fish and Chips, Chayo Mexican Restaurant, and Sprinkles. Sprinkles is one of the dessert places on the Walkway. Sprinkles serves Ice Cream, Cookies, and Cupcakes. You can go inside the store to buy your craving, but if there is too long of a line or you don't want to talk to someone, located next to the store is Sprinkles' Pink Vending Machine. You can buy cookies and cupcakes from the vending machine, but there's not a large range of flavors than ordering inside the store. My friend wanted a Cupcake for her break from work, so I went to Sprinkles. Unfortunately, there was a long line inside the store, but luckily the line at the vending machine had only one other customer. From the section they offered, I ordered the Red Velvet Cupcake. It came in a cute package and the cupcakes had a cute design also. My friend really enjoyed the cupcake. The flavors they serve depends on the day of the week so what you saw online might not be serve that day, so make sure to have back up.

If you would like to go to an average frozen custard place with the trademark response to any issue "Sorry, can't do much! That's what the system is showing.", you're at the right place! Let me explain. I purchased a weekly special (parfait, $0.50 off). While purchasing, I informed the cashier that the amount she was telling wasn't the same amount the drive-through attendant told me. I got the trademark response. Without questioning her again, I bought it and went on my merry way. I wanted to double-check the price, so I called the next morning asking the regular price and weekly special price for comparison. Then I informed the incident to the person over the phone. And got a similar response "Sorry can't do much now. I'll make sure to let others know." You might think, it's only 50 cents. That's not the issue here. It's the principle! I have worked in the service industry before. Some places would above and beyond to keep their customers happy. I didn't see such an attitude from this place. Quite disappointed, tbh! I really wanted this place to be my go-to custard place .. but I guess you can't get everything you want in life!

Walking the strip we wanted something sweet to snack on and something to wash it down with. We sampled the Better Nutter Cookie and Almond Chocolate Croissant (warmed up). If you love peanut butter you can't go wrong with the cookie. It was all sorts of peanut goodness. I'd recommend asking them to warm up your croissant - it melts in your mouth when you do! We had a Vanilla Latte and Iced London Fog (like an Earl Gray Tea Latte with Vanilla - but you have to ask for since it's not on the menu). Both were good.

The Batch House is where The Batchmaker--Cristina Rojas--bakes her way through life, one delicious batch at a time. Recently, my loving wife surprised me with some treats from The Batchmaker--an oatmeal cream pie and a caramel apple cookie. The oatmeal cream pie was unlike any I've had before. I don't know what Cristina does to make the cream rich and moist but I hope other bakers figure it out because it is life changing.

I'm definitely a big fan of Cake Boss and the artistic abilities and visions that Buddy creates. This little bakery is great in showcasing the great treats and desserts that Buddy is known for. I also love that you can see some of the pastry chefs in action. The staff are very nice and although the lines don't move too quickly at least you can watch the pastry chefs. However, I have been here twice now and still feel that the desserts are alright. I recently got an oreo lobster tail and a piece of red relvet cake. The lobster tail was way too crispy and the red velvet cake wasn't anything special. It's definitely worth going to at least once and to try out all the different options.
Oh Lord. Oh Lord. Oh Lord. Just give in to temptation. Don't deprive yourself of a small glimpse of happiness. Enjoy.
Best shaved shaved ice in the valley that I have found thus far. Lots of flavors to choose from and they also have ice cream and other treats.

I go here at least once a week. The owners and staff here go out of there way to treat you with kindness and respect. The want you to be satisfied. Highly recommend this place. Hidden gem in central Phoenix.

I was excited to try this place! I got the birthday truffles and I finished them in less than 1 minute haha. As a big fan of cookie dough, this tasted sooooo good. I considered buying the big pack after that, but I was going to the pool party at Marquee so it was not good timing. The next day, I came back and tried the cereal milk soft serve with corn flakes topping and I was hesitant to buy it since it was $6 for a super small cup but I'm so glad I did cause it was REALLY good. It was the perfect combo and even my bf liked it a lot!!

I've been here multiple times and I would show up weekly just for the entertaining people-watching but the display case filled with delicious French pastries certainly helps! This place is usually busy and bustling so, if you're a first-timer, it's preferable if you come with an 'old pro' so you won't hold up the line trying to decide on what to order. My personal favorites? The famed salted caramel brownie, chocolate and plain croissants, any of the fruit tarts, and the macarons. I've never tried any of the soups or the sandwiches but my friends have all raved about them. I would skip the house coffee - nothing special about it all. Grab a seat in the atrium and enjoy the food/ambiance!

Just basing this review on the failed macarons.. I had high expectations heading to Bouchon for their macarons and was quite disappointed. My macarons had a paper thin spread of filling inside and weren't that great. I've had better ones. They are quite big and worth the price you pay for the size you do get compared to all of the other macaron shops I have tried. Will give it another try, but will try the Bouchon in Beverly Hills next time!

Ice cream served in a Chinese take out box topped with a fortune cookie! Awesome flavors.... Blue muff (tastes just like a muffin) honey lavender (soothing to the soul)... Reasonably priced for one or two scoops! Amaze ball

This is a fantastic ice cream place. The inside is incredibly clean and has a great decor. I sampled multiple flavors and they all were amazing. The wild berry crumble was so unique and tasteful though that I couldn't not pick it. All of my family got different flavors as well and they all loved them.

This place has a fun atmosphere and amazing crepes. If you like chocolate then get their chocolate crepes. I swapped out the nuts for something else. Service was a little slow, but heaven is a long way to go to get the crepes. No judgement.

Found this place after eating AYCE Sushi. There is always place for desert with me. I'll let you guess how I found this place. It was via Yelp. I was towing a trailer with my car on it so it was a little bit hard to manuver around the side streets GPS was taking me but when I found it, I just parked it right in the front. Their lot was not big enough for my truck and trailer. Plus that evening when I went, it was packed. I got the peanut butter chocolate ice cream sundae with whip cream. Man it was good and rich. I loved every last scoop of it. The pricing here is fantastic. Its not over priced at all. I almost thought the price was wrong for a second but it wasn't. Other then that, I will be coming back here 100% when I'm in Cleveland and want pretty damn good ice cream I've ever had.

Save your money! I have heard rave reviews of Sprinkles cupcakes. I also watched every episode of Cupcakes Wars which the creator of Sprinkles cupcakes judges (now I think I will rethink her opinions). I got the cinnamon "cupcake"...I use the term cupcake loosely since mine tasted more like a dense muffin. Even if I poured milk directly on it I doubt it would be moist. My friend ordered the vanilla cupcake with milk chocolate frosting, also nothing to write home about. Overall I was thoroughly disappointed since I LOVE sweets. There are plenty of other local cupcake shops that I would choose over this chain. If someone bought me another cupcake from Sprinkles I would try it in hopes of redeeming the name but I will not be spending my money on these MUFFINS again. Sorry Sprinkles....step it up!

Great family place for ice cream after a long weekend. There is live music outside on Sundays from Wine Vault. Their presentations and signature sandwiches are great. The pictures are no lies to the fancy delectable treats they offer.

This place was amazing. Drive by on my way to the golden nugget and decided to check it out. They had a great staff and great selection of donuts. I tried their strawberry shortcake and it was amazing. I was amazed by their selection. The prices were not too bad either. Definitely returning again.

Unfortunately, by the .3 seconds that I took to inhale this awesome ice cream sandwich, I forgot to post a photo! I'm impressed, not only by the creative flavors, combinations, and doughnut with the sandwich.. I'm genuinely impressed that someone like myself that isn't a fan of sweets at all (I don't even eat my own birthday cake!) I've definitely grown an exception in the .3 seconds it took me to inhale this ice cream sandwich.. don't think about it, just trust me; you won't be disappointed. You need this in your life. Thanks novel!

Love this bakery! Amelie has 3 locations in Charlotte but this is the only one that's open 24/7. Here's several highlights about this bakery: The salted caramel brownies are delicious! This is one of their best sellers... and I'd say that it lives up to the hype. I had the rose eclair on my last visit and while it was good, it didn't beat the brownies. I've been to this location multiple times and there's always a line to place an order. My last visit was on a Saturday around 8:30PM. There were probably about 15 people ahead of me. So if you're looking for a grab and go experience, this is not the place. The ambiance is very whimsical and cute. I love it! They have plenty of seating. Lots of people seem to come here to work. I've never done it so can't testify to the quality of their wifi or number of power outlets... however judging by the crowd, I can safely assume they do pretty good job on both.

Customer service was amazing! We picked the crack pie affogato, horrible !!!! Let's just say I believe ice cream is for the soul, but I really had to throw it away, didn't care about my $15. Cereal milk was even worse.

Delicious cupcakes. Excited they finally opened one here in Vegas. This location as already mentioned in other reviews is located at the Linq. We stopped by on a Friday night. It was quite busy as one can imagine. The ice cream section was busier than the cupcake area. I got one cupcake (black and white flavor) and one doggy cupcake. Mine was delicious and I can tell my doggy enjoyed his as well. I will most certainly be back. Only docked off one star because it's not the most convenient of locations to get to.
The best ice cream I've ever had. Such a cute little shop. Owner is so kind & the ice cream is so delicious. Very underrated. Will be coming back again!

In Cosmopolitan on 2nd floor. Small place, very pricy but had some incredible milkshakes. I had the chocolate malt with a little vodka in it and it was awesome. I think I paid $12 for it in a small cup but it's Vegas - everything is expensive. Worth a stop in if you have a sweet tooth

This is a cute little spot in a shopping center off providence road. I wanted to check it out after seeing photos of the maiko special. I had no clue what the ingredients included were but I wanted to try it. Typically at a place like this, I stick with soft serve but I forced myself to venture out. The soft serve was great and the rest of it was good but for me it felt like there was too much going on. I think I'm the future I will stick to my usual choice of soft serve. They had some toast options too which looked pretty good.
Pricey but delicious. Cheese danish was light & flaky. Friendly service. Hit the spot while I waited for Vegas to wake up!

Got a fabulous custom made bday cake today for a friend! Absolutely delicious! Have had other baked items there and all were on point! Great local couple owns it and knows what they are doing! Stop in if you want a real bakery here in Charlotte.
My favorite late night spot in Vegas! The cupcake atm is so much fun and the cupcakes are always delicious! I go here at least one every time I visit Las Vegas. Definitely would recommend!
Love this place! They have the best maple walnut ice cream! Wish they had outdoor seating or more seating when you have a bigger group. Very reasonably priced.

3 Haikus about how much I love Amelie's: 1) The bread, the pastries Oh Amelie's Bakery so much yummy food 2) I wish you were in Chapel Hill. I'd visit you all the time because... 3) Your ambience is quirky and your food...your food is quite amazing!

This ice cream shop is simply amazing! They have very unique flavors. The customer service is superb. They allowed me to sample several flavors. The lavender and cream ice cream was very delightful...it has real pieces of lavender in it. The cookies and cream ice cream is real cookies and cream. If you have not been to Mason Ice Cream Shop please go TODAYYYYYYYYY!
Typical retro ice cream shop. I ordered the Apple Pie Float. Love the cinnamon sugar on top and was impressed with the flavor of the apple soda. Really yummy!
The donuts were pretty good and so was the coffee. I did think that it was a bit overpriced, but they have many specialty donuts so it was worth it. I would recommend the cake batter.

Very cool store right near the West Side Market. Its a little bit off the path but worth the block or so walk. Very interesting selection in a very "sweet" old building. I enjoyed looking around and would recommend it for a nice break from Ohio City.

This place IS all that its cracked up to be. The line is always long but worth the wait. The ice cream cookie sandwiches look great, but they are so BIG that I have never had the gusto to try them.... yet. You cannot go wrong here and I love the ever-changing flavors.

I can't give my full support to a place that reeks of snobbery and unsatisfactory ice cream. Don't get me wrong, it's DELICIOUS ice cream. But, instead of saying, "That hit the spot." afterwards, I (and my comrades) always end up saying something more like, "Well now I want a f*cking truckload of ice cream. Should I get the triple scoop? No wait, I can't afford it. Damn." Here's how to remedy falling into the unsatisfied trap: Completely overdo it. By upgrading to an ice cream sandwich, or an entrÃ©e-sized sundae with three flavors of ice cream, toffee, cookie pieces, brownie bites, torched marshmallows, hot fudge sauce, and the kitchen sink, you'll not only leave satisfied (and slightly ill, in a good way) but you'll get to appreciate why the place constantly basks in its own glory. All of the toppings and ice creams are house made, gourmet and covered in glittering, artisan snob dust. When was the last time you had an artisan, snob-dusted blow torched marshmallow? The verdict? Go big or don't go.

AmÃ©lie's French Bakery was the place to be growing up in Charlotte. After a long night clubbing and eating too much cheese at the cheese and wine party, you tend to want something sweet at 4 in the morning. As big as Charlotte is, you'd think there'd be more 24/7 places. AmÃ©lie's has always been a staple delivering fresh handmade pastries, my favorites being the chocolate hazelnut tart and the salted caramel brownie. The workers are always helpful and don't mind telling you what things are. And after seeing the lines wrapped around the building, they still greet you with a smile. The only thing I hate is the parking, although it looks ample, you may be looping around a few times till someone leaves. This by no means will stop me from coming here or giving a 5 star.

One of my fav. Cupcake shop!!! I'm so glad they open one here.. But wish it's not on the strip, so inconvenient to drive and park just to get some cupcakes. I hope they open another location on the southwest..hehe(closer to home). Tried a lot of different flavors and the only one I and my kids love most is the banana. I haven't try the ice cream yet, one of these day I'll. Don't buy the bring home and bake, it's not the same and a Waste of money!! Taste nothing like the ones they make in the store.

A great donut shop! The donuts here aren't labeled but it doesn't really matter because they all look and taste delicious. I just sort of pointed at the twelve I thought looked the tastiest. Never would I think of eating four donuts in a day but I couldn't help myself with these!

Awesome environment. Not a fan of the Elephant wars- tastes game-y... salted caramel brownies are always consistent, macaroons are delicious- but the Honey Butter flavor is the most awesome & it's seasonal :(
The best baked goods in the city - sweet and savory. For a group dessert, call and order one of their apple cakes. Ughhhh.. So good.

We came to check out this place. The ice cream is "ok". Some ice crystals, and a little fake tasting. The scoop size is very disappointing, very small. Two scoops is actually like one normal scoop anywhere else. It was kinda weird to me but they give you your ice cream on a plate. (Unless they ran out of bowls or something) it made it a little difficult to eat as the ice cream melts. The girls working behind the counter were very friendly! Great customer service.

This place was so awesome!! My sister & I were thinking of somewhere we could grab a dessert style drink or ice cream & this little gem popped up. It did not disappoint! My sister got the swirl ice cream in a cup with lucky charms cereal blended with the ice cream & lucky charms on top. I ordered the sweet matcha tea! Both were so delicious! I am typically not a fan of ice cream, but I have to say this was so good, I will definitely be back again! I highly recommend you stop in here and check it out for yourself. It's a very clean place and there are so many options when it comes to what you want. I want to try their strawberry cheesecake swirl next! Someone in front of us got it & it looked so good. The prices are fair, we paid just under $13 for both items, now thats a deal! Stop by & get your dripps on!
Great flavor. The donut with ice cream it is so good. The ice cream melts nicely. We might think it sounds too sugary but it balances the flavors.
Great pastries but they need more baker or staff or something always have to wait for the things I want

Donuts galore, people! Donuts galore! I have a major weakness for 3 things: fresh-baked chocolate chip cookies, chocolate fudge cake, and donuts. These donuts are not for the faint of heart! They are 3x the size of a normal donut packing in lots of sweetness and an explosion of flavor! They sold me on the sugar donut topped with homemade whipped cream and strawberries (which I split, rather reluctantly!) while my friend also took a vanilla donut to go. Their donuts are fresh and soft and perfect for the start of a Monday.

Since this was probably our only opportunity to try the famous Milk Bar, we decided to go for the tasting. The cake pop was incredibly sweet (as I think most are), The soft serve with corn flakes was good, the cookie was just ok, and the crack pie was very good. Probably wouldn't return to spend that much unless it was for the pie.

I wish I had more to say, but here's my endorsement: I am lactose intolerant, and the Chocolate Shoppe is so good that I don't even care. Every flavor I've ever had here outweighs the pain. A tiny bit pricy, but some things are worth it. I also love that they have a location in the West Towne Mall.

Not worth the hype!!! The cereal milk soft serve tasted odd (they were also cheap on the fudge) and the cake offerings were over the line sweet, making them not enjoyable. You're better off somewhere else for dessert!

5 stars for my Napoleon and coconut macaroons. 0 stars for the customer service. Some of the pastries aren't labeled and when I asked about a specific one I was told: "it's just a brownie". Gee, thanks, pal. The cashier made us feel bad for wanting Seagrams ginger ale instead of Boylans; saying Seagrams had no ginger in it. Also, I asked for extra milk in my cafe au lait only to be asked, "do you just not want coffee in it?". I don't get the elitist coffee culture happening. Atmosphere is bizarre, the place looks like a modge podge of leftover furniture and arts and crafts projects gone wrong. Overall, don't ask questions and get a dessert to go.

Great ice cream. Tastes super fresh and I like the little Chinese take out containers. One weird complaint; the spoons! They're like a prank of some kind - bending so much you can barely snag a mouthful. But go there anyway...
I've been to both locations a few times. I tried the cotton candy macaroon on my last visit and I fell in love with it. I ended up eating about 5 while sitting there at 4am

I have now visited Villani's 4 times and every time Has always been a great experience. The Italian cream cake is excellent. Other items that I would recommend are the Lemon Bars and Oatmeal Raisin Cookies. This is now my go to bakery.

I'm probably the only person in Charlotte that hasn't visited Amelie's and shame on me. I stopped in for a desert and coffee on a Saturday afternoon. The pastry selection here was awesome. There is a one problem though, How do you choose? I had at least 3 items that I didn't think I could leave without. The coffee was also excellent. The service was friendly and fast. The decor is very eclectic and cool. Lots of different places to sit, with different tables and chairs, inside, outside, etc. A great place to stop in and just hang out for a bit, relax and grab a bite. I can't wait to come back and try a sandwich.

Delicious! We had Dough melts. I ordered Cookie Monster ice cream with Oreo cookie topping. The glazed donut was warm and soft. Great customer service! They also offer flights. They had an ice cream with bacon that was savory and so good. I can't wait to go back. This place is awesome I'm happy we have this in Phoenix.
Nice wide layout, quite spacious while looking at the goodies. wished they had a few more table seating, considering this being a new area and all. Good chocolate, still prefer my Lindt.

Prices seemed fair. 2 cannoli and two iced mochas were under around $10. The wait was very long despite how many employees were there it seemed only a few were actually getting anything done. One woman helped our group of 4 and when I tried getting a young mans attention to add to our order he told me that I would need to talk to the woman helping us. The cannoli was amazing though and so was the iced mocha. Everything in the place looked fantastic. If I ever find myself back in Cleveland I will surely spend more time in little Italy.

We taste tested 6 donuts. The grilled cheese and French toast were warm and delicious. None of the other donuts we taste tested were edible. By far Not the best donuts in the world........ Creme brÃ»lÃ©e was greasy, topping too hard and too thick, and cream was almost nonexistent. JJust about broke a tooth. Bought two because of the hype. Waste of money. If you're charging premium $$$$$ at the very least don't go cheap on the cream........ Bacon apple fritter was hyped. Horribly bland, almost no cinnamon and no apples. Horribly hard. Nothing was fresh. Everything was hard. Chocolate deluxe was all yeast with just chocolate on top. Nothing special. Wasn't fresh. Everything tasted like yesterday's donuts. And btw, we came early hoping to get them fresh for fair taste test. Last but not least, poor selection. More donut selection and much fresher at DD. Better value too. If you can't produce consistently high quality then don't charge high prices...... And don't hard stuff my dog wouldn't eat. Toss them, don't sell em.....

This is the place I always suggest to visitors! I always want to take them to Amelie's because of the different vibe, unique decor, and delicious food. It just seems to be a Charlotte staple. I have tried several of the different pastries and desserts but I always end up landing back on the French Macaroons - my favorite: the pistachio (although I liked it better before they started adding the pistachio pieces on the outside, I think the extra baking of the pistachios changes their flavor). Anyway, I thought this was a great place to come and do homework when I was in graduate school, as it allowed for me to chill with my headphones or have group study sessions. The tricky part is timing. I have gone in with no line, and I have gone in other times and the line is wrapped into the other rooms of the building. Seating can also be tricky as well due to popularity.

The little store front was right at the entrance between TI and the Venetian so it caught my eye. I had a raspberry and a pistachio macaroon. They were perfect and large in size; I thought they were fairly priced at $3.50. The young man working was very friendly and had a great sense of humor!

Yes I will give Amelie's five stars for their fresh delivery of their pastries. Salted caramel brownie is number one. However the sandwiches are pricey for 1 to 2 ounces of meat. Also I remember previously hearing about the employees being mistreated and not paid overtime and I do not like supporting businesses that mistreat employees.
Mitchells is #1 in Cleveland. That's all I can say. The flavors are unreal. The freshness is crazy. The amaretto cookie is just stupid tasty.

Fun space in a very charming part of Ohio City. It's mature tree lined on a one way street. There is parking off street or on the south side of the building. Mind you, we went on a Saturday night. The line was massive. After waiting 40 minutes, I was super excited for my choice. And wouldn't you know it, the person in front of me got the last of it! Me and my big trap shouldn't have told my BF why I was so excited to try it ....grrr. So the lady was super nice about having me try samples but was deflated and no longer excited. The ice cream we got was very good. Portions are the kind that make you wish you would have ordered two. Not sure if I will ever wait that long again. But would like to give it another shot

Omg this place is absolutely amazing with their fresh mad ice cream and delicious cookie cup! They have an original and unique selection of ice cream flavors that are all so delicious! I have been a few times since I moved to Arizona and will keep going back! So glad I found this place! The cookie cup has your choice of ice dream, your choice in flavor of macaroon cookie on top, then topped with a crisped marshmallow! Absolutely amazing creation!

I feel like this place is overhyped. The first time i had it, my boyfriend bought me a box of different pastries and it was okay and expected more. Second time I ordered cake for his birthday and side desserts. It tasted stale and wasn't worth the price. Haven't been back since and i don't think I ever will.

This place is so good!!! And the store manager that works there is so friendly. My girlfriend and I went here during one of our date nights and we had some ice cream and it was delicious. Can't wait to go back

I watched Christina Tosi as a master chef judge and was curious to try her desserts. Although the hype for this place is good, the prices are outrageous, however the quality is better than other dessert places I been to. And for the size of the dessert, it's a no go for the price. I got the bite sized cookie dough flavored confetti and it was really good, it was one of their truffles. The others were the cookies and they tasted kind of like any other cookie but with a different flavor than your typical cookie. The three cookies ran for $11 and the flavors were confetti, marshmallow and blueberry. The cookie truffle was 7$ and you get three small balls. It was definitely an experience that will be remembered. Was it worth the price tag? Hell No! But was it worth the experience. Yes! I would say give it a one time try and call it quits. I wouldn't go back, but the dessert is very good. Service was nonchalant. The employee that served me was kind of boring and annoyed about the pandemic, but pretty much everyone is. They wore gloves as well as having a clear shield in front so you don't come in contact with the employee. It's a mess but it is part of history for us folks.

Always my favorite donut shop but I am not downtown enough to enjoy it. Always make sure to stop by early to get prime picks or else you are left with the dreaded leftover offerings! Which are still going to be amazing, let's be honest.

Go to Sweet Republic this week and say, "I support Bake for Hope," and they will donate a portion of their proceeds to Bake for Hope. Bake for Hope is a charity that is raising breast cancer awareness and providing proceeds of nationwide bake sales to local Susan G Komen for the Cure affiliate offices. On this Saturday, Bake for Hope will be there to sell our delicious homemade cupcakes, brownies, and cookies. It is the PERFECT pairing- cake and ice cream!

During a recent business trip, my friend and I visited Bouchon Bakery (one of the three in the Venetian) for an early breakfast. I was amazed by the selection, but settled for a strawberry croissant and two of their spherical beignets. The croissant was buttery and full of strawberry goodness...better yet, the two small beignet orbs will filled with raspberry jam and were fantastic. A wonderful, small breakfast to start the day!

Confetti Cake!!!!!!!! First, I want to make it clear that I'm not a cake person, BUT this cake is to die for. It was sooo damn good I didn't even have a moment to take a picture of it. It has magical crunchies inside every bite. It was nothing like I ever expected. 10/10 I would recommend to everyone and their mothers. It was so yummy I came back the next day to try the strawberry short cake and once again I was blown away.

Sweets were pricey but didn't try. I didn't expect anything out of their savory food because I just wanted a quick bite for dinner but my dad and I got a pizza which was ok/solid, pasta which was good, and the stromboli was amazing!!! It was just presented on the side of the place and we said screw it just microwave it for us but it ended up tasting super good? Meat strombolis are good but for some reason I reallllly liked the veggie one. Highly recommend.
Great place! Highly recommend, very friendly people too. Gotta try the halo halo. Got really unique selection here.
Cinnamon roll shake was amazing!!! As well as the chocolate PB. Prices are fair. I'll definitely be back again.

So I went here on 2 occasions. 1st visit I would have given a 4 star for delicious rasberry macroon and white chocolate mocha. 2nd visit I would have given a 2 star for hard pastry and giving me a latte instead of a mocha; even when I brought it to their attention they insisted it was a mocha not a latte; which for anyone that drinks coffee knows there is a clear difference..

YUM ALERT YUM ALERT!!!!! I. Love. The Chocolate Shoppe. All the flavors are delicious, but I especially recommend the Coconut Almond Bliss and the Cake Batter Fudge. Sometimes the employees aren't that friendly, but hey, everyone has their bad days!

Typical Chinese bakery with several dozen kinds of pastries, cakes, and drinks. Obviously popular, most customers carried trays of selected pastries lining up to pay. As usual, most pastries were mild sweet, just the way I liked them. It's a perfect place to satisfy sweet and carbohydrates cravings. 4*Matcha Red Bean: only a few red beans on top, the rest was some kind of sponge cake and cream. 5*Taro Swirl: crispy and mild sweet, perfectly buttery!

This place is THE BEST. I am addicted to matcha.. there is something about the grittiness bitter x sugar that I am obsessed with. Charlotte needs more asian fusion places if it really wants to be a diverse city so Matcha Cafe Maiko is a step in the right direction. Extra points for being in the suburbs so parking isn't hard. The matcha soft serve is premium grade- you can tell by the intensity of the color and how prominent the flavor is. Not a vanilla soft serve green tea ice cream you can get at a buffet but it ranks as high as Cha Cha Matcha in NYC. It packs a punch though so if you eat it on a weekend night expect to stay up for the next 6 hours. Also get the black sesame or hojicha ice cream, I actually feel like I'm in Japan. When I'm committed I will get the soft serve cone because they really top it high for you, but when I'm on the go I like getting the matcha float (they put matcha ice cream on top of matcha sugar water- it's good, I promise. They have a latte float version too but I can't handle so much dairy at once.) I wouldn't go there for the special though just because the way it's compiled makes it hard for you to mix the ice cream and the crunchy toppings. Anyway, was thinking of you Matcha Cafe Maiko so just thought I'd drop in and leave a review. Keep being amazing and come to the Triangle area thank you. Would give y'all 6 stars if I could
Super sweet staff that offers suggestions if you are on the fence, worth coming here for their ice cream or unique sundae combos!

Although nothing bizarre, the conservative type flavors are still solid choices. My favorites were Italian Cherry and Cookies and Mint. Everything was good, but those two really stood out. The creaminess of the ice cream is key to the ice cream's success. The flavorings are also quite potent, which I like. Nothing breaks my heart more than mildly flavored ice cream. I wanted to try their shakes or sundaes, but I also needed to save room for elsewhere at the time. I did pick a pretzel cone for my scoop. The pretzel isn't bad, but it wasn't what I was expecting. Its not as crumbly as a traditional waffle cone. Its not necessarily as sweet either, but it does add an undeniably delicious saltiness to each bite.
Great ice cream and neat environment. Brought some out-of-town guests and they loved it as well. Will be back!

Cool (ha ha) place for ice cream. Good service but pretty pricey. We used a Groupon which took the bite (ha ha) out of it but it was still $12 for not very much. I wlll save this for special events. If you do not choose teh Daddy specials with the macaroon, you will save some dough but then it won't be so special...

Being from Youngstown, I was soooo excited to hear that Handel's was coming to Las Vegas. There is NOTHING like this here. DQ, Baskin Robbins...ICK. Ive had to settle for frozen yogurt. When you've had Handel's everything else mine as well be from the freezer section of the grocery store in a carton. Its just like home, stand outside and wait in line at a walk up window. I got my usual, a scoop of grape and a scoop of vanilla w oreo. YUMMY! Had some of Eds butter pecan....OMG so delish. The flavors are the same as Ohio (thank goodness). My reason for 4 stars is because the scoops seemed a lil skimpy compared to Youngstown which was a lil disappointing but my waistline thanks me :) Vegas....go treat yourself. If you love ice cream, there's NO DOUBT you will fall in love. Unsure what to choose from all the flavors? Just ask for a sample.

After eating lunch at the Arrogant Butcher and a bit of walking around downtown Phoenix, me and my girlfriend headed back to her place in Scottsdale; but made a quick stop at Sweet Republic to satisfy our craving for something sweet. Upon walking in I had no idea just how famous this place was, until I saw a wall covered in press articles of recognition & until I saw the "As Seen on the Food Network" stamped on their menu for one of their ice cream dishes, the "Toffee Banofi" a double scoop of Madagascar Vanilla, fresh bananas, almond toffee brittle & salted butter caramel sauce. The interior is modern; slightly reminding me of Pinkberry and its modern decor. There is the counter that contains the ice cream, sorbets, and pastries. There are tables and chairs both inside and outside. There is a help-yourself water dispenser which came in handy after I got thirsty from eating 2 scoops of ice cream. There is also a stack of board games, near the water dispenser, to choose from and play with as you enjoy your ice cream at the tables. I admit that I'm boring when it comes to my preference for ice cream flavors. I tend to choose either vanilla or chocolate (or rocky road if I'm feeling adventurous). So surprise, surprise I ordered a scoop of their Madagascar Vanilla + a scoop of their Belgian Chocolate. You can definitely taste the quality and care that went into making these flavors. I personally preferred the Belgian Chocolate over the Madagascar Vanilla since the flavor was a bit more developed. I was able to sample the Horchata and the Espresso which were good but probably a bit too much for me had I ordered a scoop. Had I not been so full from lunch I would've liked to try the "Campfire S'more" a double scoop of Belgian Chocolate, roasted marshmallow & hot fudge in a waffle bowl but I suppose this is just one of many reasons to re-visit Arizona again!

I can't even begin to explain how much I love this place. Their baked goods are unlike any baked goods you've had before and I can promise you that. This location is new, but we used to drive all the way from Las Vegas to their location in Irvine, CA to spend $50 worth of stuff to bring home and snack on for a week. It was costly, but that's why I'm so happy to have a bakery so close by now. The layout of their operation is great too. No more waiting in line while servers rush to bring all of your items together. Grab a tray, grab some tongs, and pick up all the things you want, then bring the tray to the cashier for checkout. They will individually package each item for you if you're taking them to go. And every time I get to the checkout with a tray absolutely piled high with goodies, I'm always pleasantly surprised at how little it actually cost me. If you get the chance to try their coffees too, go for it! You will not regret coming here.

By far my favorite local ice cream shop! It's a small place and there is usually a line, but it is worth it. My favorite flavor is the "Sweet Cream," which they don't have on display. The atmosphere is great and the customer service has always been good too!

We got a Pain au Raisin and Banana Nut Muffin with 2 coffees. They were good, but given the expensive price tags, it's only 3stars worthy. Honestly I've had better pastries. BTW, you can't charge it to the room because they are not associated with the hotel! Lame!
I had heard they had the best donuts in Cleveland. I agree. Huge selection. These are not your average donuts and they aren't cheap BUT they are worth every penny and calorie!!
Best donuts I have ever tasted and I have tried almost every shop in town. Get there early otherwise you may miss out!

The pacific sunset snow-cone and the cookies & cream ice cream are the best you'll find in town. My boyfriend and I love coming in for pints of ice cream to-go, along with our dessert for that night. You guys are the absolute best and the owner is so nice! Theres just one thing....the amount of times we have been craving a snow cone or some scoops of ice cream after 8pm is insane. We wish you guys would be able to find a way to stay open later, we know in Arizona a lot of people don't come out until the sun goes down. For the summer you should look into this maybe as the sun will be going down at 8pm. We can't wait to enjoy your delicious food again.

OMG, this is the best ice cream that have ever had. Thank god Mitchell's isn't around the corner from where I live. My absolute fav is the pistachio,ummmmmmmmmm. My daughter had me addicted to this place. The staff is always friendly & the store is always neat and clean.

I woke a little early to make sure I didn't miss the infamous French toast donut and it did not disappoint. Dropped in this morning around 9 am and ordered a variety of donuts and of course the French toast "only sold on weekends" and it was absolutely yummy!!! Highly recommend if you in the mood and in the area!

This review is solely for the cannolis. We did not try anything else at the bakery yet. But the cannolis were quite disappointing for how expensive they were and for such a well reviewed place. We will not be returning for those.
Very tasty and was delivered on time and with a call to confirm. Great birthday gift and very easy to order!!

Presti's. We've been coming here for for over 25 years. Kathy has been coming here even longer than that (I think add at least another 20 years, shh). I think they do a very good job with lunch items and their prices are reasonable. Coffee is decent and the baked goods are worth the calories and the price point is fair. I have other places in the area that I like more for baked goods, deli food, and coffee. However, no one has a combination of quality in all three off those categories, plus price, and pretty fast friendly service. And the clincher for Presti's is atmosphere. There's an ambiance I can only describe as a little worn, a little chic, a little hint of Cleveland attitude (in a good "it is what it is" kind of way), along with a dash of theatre. Or maybe that's the espresso kickin' in.

Fun and charming atmosphere. The service is always good. Some of the lunch sandwiches are a little pricey but always delicious. I'm not thrilled with a lot of the desserts for the price. All the ones I've tried are just a disappointment. Too rich, or not as tasty as expected, and very pricey. One I do enjoy is the almond twice baked croissant. Drinks are all good and worth trying.
Absolutely delicious. Lots of choices, some very unique. I loved the one filled different cookies in it (forget the name). The mint is very interesting - very fresh tasting.

Amelie's is a great spot to catch up with friends, get work done, and satisfy your sweet tooth. We stop by Amelie's quite frequently to pick up a sweet treat or breakfast sandwiches. The interior is quite intriguing with the variety of colors and different design styles. It is spacious with a good amount of seating but it tends to get packed very quickly!! The lines wrap around since it's such a go to spot for many. Our favorites are their macarons (Pistachio and Salted Caramel) and their cinnamon sticks! As for breakfast sandwiches, we tend to do the build your own and customize it to our likings.

A great place to get your sugar fix after a nice dinner. No place to sit. No place to even put your food down for a second. Yes, the corn flakes in the vanilla ice cream was really good. Of course, the helpings look small, but it was plenty for two of us. Speed was good considering there was a line. Great place to try once if you are tourist.

Because I stayed at the Venetian, it was inevitable that I passed this place every time I left/went to the room. After seeing the good reviews on yelp I decided to give it a try. $17.50 or so for a box of about 6? A bit pricey, but what isn't in Vegas? Out of all the flavors, I liked only the espresso one. It had a good amount of coffee taste to it, but not overwhelming. The filling used for these macarons are not overly sweet which tends to be the case with most places. But basically, all the other flavors with the exception of chocolate and espresso basically tasted to same to me. And maybe it was a bad batch, but out of the 6, I think half of them were hollow in the middle. Which is not how a properly made macaron should be. The girl that helped us was a bit slow? But maybe it's been a long day. Overall, they're alright. Not the best I've ever had. But if you must try something, I would definitely go for the espresso.

Ice cream here is good but owners are NOT customer focussed. I have never been to an ice cream place that charges you ADDITIONAL charges to change the ice cream flavor on a sundae, until today. Very nickel and dime. I usually would not object to something like this, but they already charge very high premium prices, and it felt like buying a car with the upsell prices. When you buy one scoop of ice cream are the prices different for every scoop? If I want a scoop of Belgium Chocolate, the price should be less since the other flavors cost more to substitute, from the smores sundae, right??? First time I had ice cream and left with a bad taste in my mouth (actually in the end I left without ordering what I intended and went to Cold Stone). While the ice cream is good I'm not sure it is worth the attitude.

Went to the grand opening today on Friday, 12/6/19. Headed there by 815am and there was a line about 50 people. Luckily it wasn't too cold that 45 minutes waiting did feel bad. I got the ticket for the free yard tea which I choose was jasmine tea. When 9am hit, the unlv cheerleaders did a small performance, ribbon cutting, and red good luck streamers came down. By 9am the line was all the way down to the bbq place. Line went quick to get in and it was pretty organized. The main items were there, however not full menu they had. Only gripe was it was crowded getting thru with the fresh bread getting refilled. Make sure you look at every item so you don't have to fight the crowd going back. Because I got the tea, I didn't get my usual boba definitely will going back. Now I don't have to drive to So Cal !

It was one of those nights when I wanted something sweet and cold, but I didn't want your average joe ice cream. I read about Sweet Republic in a local magazine and I couldn't believe a Cheese Course Duo ice cream was offered at the shop. It was a necessity for me to try it that night. I was the only one in the shop by the time I arrived, being close to quitting time but the woman behind the counter was extremely helpful. The first thing I wanted to sample was the Cheese Duo flavor. It consisted of Roquefort cheese and Medjool dates. It was intense, rich and very unexpected. It was delicious but I wanted something "cooler". Then, as I walked over to the sorbet area, the flavor, Mango Lassi, caught my eye right away. I knew at that moment, the Mango Lassi was my treat for the night. I was so sure of myself, that I didn't even sample it. Once I put the spoon in my mouth, my craving was fulfilled, and I was happy. Nice location, simple interior..i don't want to say Pinkberry inspired interior, but that's what it reminded me of. Thank you Sweet Republic. I'll be back. Gen

We came here for a sweet bite after eating across the street at Federal Pizza. The line was out the door, but no one seemed to mind waiting. I was too busy looking at all the retro candy from my childhood, so when I got to the front of the line...I had no clue what I wanted and didn't want to hold the line up. So, one of the gals suggested the Peanut Butter ice cream (score!) and the pretzel cone I had already planned to try...because...it's a pretzel and a cone! I loved the creamy natural tasting peanut butter ice cream, but the cone was a bit of a let down. It was a tad too salty and not light and airy like a regular pretzel. It was thick and on the crunchy side. So, I think I'll skip it the next time I go in. We enjoyed sitting out back though! Make sure you make your way back there instead of sitting out front where the line is a bit in the way.

This is definitely a different approach on classic ice cream shop. Instead of the classic "baked bear" ice cream sandwich or cold stone waffle cone, Fatty Daddy's delivers a melange if textures and tastes. Each component of my treat, had a different layer of creaminess! First, a cloud of roasted Smokey marshmallow that falls. Then comes a delicate silky macaroon. Lastly, a frosted hill of smooth ice cream. I asked the guy his favorite mix - Irish cream ice cream with a Carmel macaroon. We both got some and enjoyed everything!

I really like Milk Bar. I visited the Vegas location for the first time recently (previously I had only been in New York), and it's a cute little counter spot located in The Cosmopolitan. For those that don't know, Milk was created by Christina Tosi, who founded the dessert programs at the Momofuku restaurants. This makes Milk a huge draw for a lot of people (including me), so don't be surprised if you visit and it's packed. We lucked out and it was completely empty when we stopped by early on a weekday, so we had no wait and we were able to order quickly. On this visit I opted for a Cereal Milk Latte, as I had just had breakfast and didn't have room for much more, but Milk offers so much more! They're slinging some standard desserts including truffles, pie, milkshakes, cake, and cookies; BUT, they offer them up in flavors you're not going to find anywhere else. First, their Birthday Cake flavor is unlike any other. Why? I don't know. It just is. And it's delicious! Try the Birthday Cake or the B'Day Truffles. They also have Cereal Milk (like my latte) and the Milk Bar Pie (a.k.a. Crack Pie) is bomb! If you're in the mood to opt for a cookie, try The Compost Cookie, it's got a hodgepodge of mix-ins, and it's delicious! And this Vegas location has tons of alcoholic drink options as well. Milk is a bit pricey, and depending on when you visit there may be a line, but I honestly think the desserts are worth it. It's not fancy, so please don't expect that, but if you're looking for a delicious cake, cookie, or pie, then Milk Bar is your spot.

Where has this ice cream been all my life?! Absolutely- delicious! The texture and flavor is unlike any other. I had a chocolate scoop paired up with a chocolate dipped waffle cone... because I obviously love chocolate, and it was chocolate heaven for my taste buds. Now let's talk about customer service. The BEST customer service received on my entire trip. We were greeted promptly at the door. We got free chocolate samples. Someone was ready at the register. I enjoyed the atmosphere so much, I decided to sit down and have my ice cream inside the establishment. Which was well kept and welcoming. #TeamGhirardelli

This might be my favorite Ice Cream shop in Arizona. And it get so much better as it's local! SUPPORT YOUR LOCAL COMPANIES! THIS IS MERICUH!! Actually to be honest I'll support any shop that has ice cream in it. Some information I guess since this is a review. -My favorite Ice Cream flavors by far are the Salted Butter Caramel and the Maple Pecan. But I've never had a bad flavor yet from them. And oh you better believe that I have tried them all. Possibly sampled every flavor every time I've went. -I love that it is open til 10pm. Seriously, who hasn't had the late night cravings for ice cream?? and Wow Thanks to Yelp I now know that it is open til 11pm on Fridays and Saturdays. This place gets better and better! If they would now only be open 24 hours then my dream of having premium ice cream at 3am can now be fulfilled. -They have Almond brittle -They have Bacon Brittle -Let me repeat that. They have BACON Brittle. This is by far the best bacon brittle that I've had. Makes me want to buy a package and sprinkle it all over everything. IF bacon makes everything taste better, how about bacon brittle?!? -Toffee Banofi. Just get it. I rate this place 5 stars. Woohoo! As good as it gets!
Sooooo many choices. The line is long. But it moves at a decent pace. Worth the wait. Delicious ice cream.

Every time I'm in Vegas, I have to stop by and get a slice of birthday cake. Usually love this place, but this time, I can't get over the thought that they changed the frosting recipe as it doesn't taste like cream cheese frosting but shortening frosting instead. Based on prior experience and the price I paid, had higher expectations.
Banana with strawberry topping is my favorite. Nice atmosphere great product.
Their macaroon ice cream sandwiches are delicious! Definitely recommend Ninety's for a sweet treat!

All of the baked goods are super tasty and amazing. The coffee also makes my spine tingle because it is so good. It's a great place to take pictures if you're a teen, or young adult, and you're into that vintage, edgy vibe. I would highly recommend rolling down to this cool, hipster bakery. I attached a picture of our lattes, please enjoy.

mmmmm.. macarons..i had 2 of each to bring back home to share with the wifey. when i told her i was going to vegas she asked to bring something back from bouchon. im glad she did. she loved the pistacio. my fave was the coffee flavored one. theyre also quite larger than others i've tried... i also had to try the oreos and too bad i only got 2.

Brah! Winnahz. Creme brÃ»lÃ©e was set on kill mode. Fresh, slight crispy crust. Jus the right amount of custard filling. And the caramelized sugar on top would shatter as you bit in. Had to have another one. Forgot to take a pic
Delicious treats galore! As everyone does, I recommend the salted caramel brownie and their chicken salad sandwich! So good and a great hangout place. Especially when's there's nothing to do at 3 am!
Came here for coffee every morning as it was right below the elevators at the Venetian, and they can elevate even a simple americano. Huge fan of Bouchon!

So Handel's changed their cup design for their hot fudge sundaes. The cups are now designed to hold them in your hand easier but there is definitely less ice cream in them. Yet they still charge the same price. Not cool.

This place was absolutely terrific. My sister had seen them on social media and so we thought we would give it a try. As soon as we walked in, we were warmly greeted by the friendly workers who were more than willing to answer my never ending questions. They were eager to let us try as many flavors as we wanted and they were super helpful in making the final ice cream decision. I would most definitely recommend this place to anyone who is an ice cream lover!
This went from a storefront to a corner ice cream stand in front of JoBot. Good ice cream and service with a smile!

Short Review: Donut Bar originated in San Diego and places an emphasis on fresh, tasty, picture worthy, and creative donuts. If a caked donut full of sugar is your thing, then give Donut Bar a try. Donut Bar is considered one the best and their customer service is excellent. Just be early because these donuts sell out fast. Longer Review: I remember the excitement when Donut Bar opened in Las Vegas. I'm not going to lie. I wasn't that excited when I heard the news. I didn't bookmark this place and had the opinion that Donut Bar was just hype. I'm originally from the 619 and remember when the first Donut Bar opened their doors in Daygo. I was one of those people that waited in line. The owner of that location was pretty cool and would walk by the line with full sized donut samples to patrons waiting to get in. Originally, I wasn't a fan. I had a few failed visits because their donuts were either out or I got something that was too sweet. I always picked a donut that just didn't "wow" me. I am also not into a cake donut with a bunch of sugar on it. I'm really boring when it comes to my donuts. I prefer a chocolate glazed raised donut, maple bar, cruller, or an apple fritter. That's all I really need or want when I'm in a donut shop. But when the girlfriend loves donuts, then you support her by eating donuts. I have been here a couple of times since grand opening week. I've tried the Samoa, The French Toast, Cake Batter, Caramel Latte, the Big Poppa Tart, CrÃ¨me Brulee, Matcha Cake, PB&J, and of course, the Homer. Their originality, freshness, and consistency stands out. I haven't had anything here that was too oily and greasy. Again, these donuts really do not appeal to me and in my opinion, just too sweet. But then I had their Caramel Latte. This donut is perfectly glazed with their latte flavor. Then a little whipped cream and caramel is added. Because this donut is large, the glaze and toppings do not give it that overly sweet taste. The texture is also perfect and not dry at all. This donut with a cup of their hot coffee equals perfection. I will cheat on my chocolate raised donut any day for their Caramel Latte. This donut alone made me a fan. 2017 Yelp Review #77
Really enjoyed my sandwich and pastry. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Definitely will be back.
Some of the best ice cream, I've ever had! Love the unique flavors. I had the Honey vanilla and the Gooey Buttecream, and they were both delicious!

I've been waiting so long to come to Page's and already knew I'd order a Nancy B's chocolate chip cookie sundae. It didn't disappoint-- tons of hot fudge, whipped cream, creamy soft serve and warm cookie pieces. I love that they have so many types of milkshakes, sundaes and arctic swirls -- I'd love to come back and try the raspberry almond torte sundae or one of their pumpkin roll arctic blasts I've heard they have in the fall!

Me and my friends had a great time at novel ice cream Sara Jalen and Nami took great care of us and were great conversationalists. The butter pecan ice cream is great and the cookie monster was great too. Highly recommend stopping by for a visit

The macarons were pretty standard, and on the pricey side unless you get a 5 pack. Would give them 4 stars, but the first time we tried to go there, it was an absolute nightmare. We asked two Venetian employees where it was; one gave directions to the "closest one" and said there were three locations, the other said there was only one location and directed us to the one under the escalators by the Grand Lux. We arrived at that location 7 minutes before 9 (closing time) and the place was abandoned. We made it to the one facing the Strip about 3 minutes later just by chance and it was also closed. That location also opened late the next morning when we went back and I would have foregone the entire thing had I not wanted macarons so badly before my flight home. On the plus side, there was no line at all and I really liked the packaging of the 5-pack for the airplane.

Presti's is awesome! I live essentially right next door to the place and love to get cannolis and cafe au laits when I just want to relax and catch up with a friend. I don't get to see one of my friends much, but when I do, we ALWAYS go to Presti's. At times, we get overwhelmed with the crowd there, but we never fail to see cute babies and indulge in some fantastic desserts! The stromboli is amazing as well! The convenience is also incredibly appreciated, as there was once a wine filled evening when we all wanted some cookies. Luckily, they're not only convenient, but delicious too!
Excellent Freezie!!!! Salted Carmel Oatmeal cookie freezie was the bomb and the biodegradable spoons are so cute and sturdy!!!
Awesome food at this location!! I have only tried the sandwiches and salads yet i have NEVER been disappointed. The Rock Hill location has a limited menu though...
Oh my god has to be the best place on earth. My wife and daughter took me there for the first time the other night and I won't go anywhere else again.
The cannolis were amazing. My kids loved the rainbow cake. My sweet craving was definitely satisfied!

Kid in a candy shop. That's the nostalgia Sloan's gave me upon walking in. I forgot to count how many flavors but my oh my it's a several dozen! We all found our ice creams to be delicious. Employees were attentive and available. Prices were up there but considering it's in the Venetian what else would one except? They also had a wall lined with candy! Yup you heard me! I'll be back, with my local friends and tourists. Literally can't wait!
Ice Cream!! Oh Yeah!! This is one of my favorite places to go. Everything is so delicious. Favorite pick :. Chocolate Peanut Nut Butter Milkshake. Need I say more.... it's the best!!!!

Now as a vegan, I wanted to write a new review to reflect my thoughts on Novel Ice Cream. I visited with some friends on Friday night. The space is really small and there were two people behind the counter serving samples, scooping scoops, and checking us out. With about 6-7 people ahead of us, It took about 15 minutes before we got to the ordering counter. We taste tested the two vegan flavors that they offered in the current moment - lychee and some sort of berry sorbet. The berry sorbet was VERY sweet, but the lychee was perfect! I shared a double scoop with my partner and added a single vegan topping. While the berry was overly sweet, the lychee was able to tone it down a bit. I believe they also offer a vegan sprinkle cookie and certain cereals as toppings! Maybe they'll make vegan doughnuts or offer more vegan flavors one day?? Know that there was plenty of street parking when we arrived. There was a scatter of people before our arrival. When we got our ice cream, there was a long line of about 15 people down the ramp! Timing is everything I suppose. Love the vegan offerings and will be back/recommend because of this!
Try the hazelnut cream puff. It will knock your socks off. Went on a Tuesday so very short line and live music across the hall at buddy's made the wait fun.
Cupcakes very dry...disappointing. Was really looking forward to some good cake on my birthday!!!

I give the Confetti Cookie 4 stars - delicious! The Chocolate Chocolate cookie's flavor leaned a little too heavy on the dark chocolate side for my husband's liking (and for mine). I tried the Cereal Milk White Russian. I think it would be better without the cereal milk flavor. Husband had a chocolate cereal shake and found the cereal milk flavor to be too overpowering. I guess it's just not for us, but if you are someone who lurvvs cereal milk, then this place might be perfect for you!
Phenomenal flavor selection! They make it hard to pick just one or two! Really friendly service as well.
Lovely place, great customer service! Yummy ice cream ( we tried Nutella, Vanilla, and Coffee flavors) with choices of toppings and best with macaron and burnt marshmallow!!

Donuts & coffee, the forever couple. This place gets it right in a cute downtown location. I went early afternoon on a weekday and there was still a good selection of a variety of flavors. These are really aesthetic "crowd-pleasing" donuts, I tried three. They're lighter (yeast-raised) than fancy donuts elsewhere, not so much the "i had two and I don't need to eat again today" I've run into elsewhere. The prices are also surprisingly competitive. Discounts for a dozen, and there were some basic bar-shaped donuts for just a dollar when I was there. This place won't break the bank. There's curbside parking (metered), and a shared shady courtyard out back. Check it out.

I have never had ice cream that was soo good... we ordered a cookies and cream scoop and then a churro sandwich with vanilla a ice cream with some caramel drizzle! Oooooo! If you are not dog friendly I suggest another ice cream shop, (maybe Mitchell's down the street ?) We came and didn't really know until we were here and wondering why there were so many dogs! This cute little shop can get VERY crowded. The staff here is VERY friendly and willing to help with whatever you need. I will be coming back for more of the churro! So savory and just enough sugar. Thank you so much for the lovely experience! Also, a small note! If you're into cafes and coffee shops there are A TON of the cutest little places in this area as well!

When I die and go to heaven, as I step off the plane, St. Peter (and my mom) will meet me with a tray of pastries from Bouchon bakery!!! LOL The almond croissants and macarons are pretty damn close to being the best things I've ever put in my mouth!

Jeni's is a feel good ice cream shop for the whole family. It features very unique ice cream flavors! I always order the Texas sheet cake which is the perfect combination of cake and ice cream, what's even better is it's Dairy free. Yay!!

Novel Ice Cream has one of the best ice cream makers in the country. The result is ice cream which is creamy, and full of flavor - a decadent treat. Give into your cravings and go to Novel. I had been looking for my favorite flavor - Rum Raisin; when Brandon learned of my search, he asked his ice cream maker to create it. The result? Best Rum Raisin ice cream Ever! It is full of rum, they even soaked the raisins in it, it is very flavorful - perfect for the holidays. I bought two half gallons. All of their flavors are made with premium ingredients by one of the best! Novel will be opening another store in Mesa (on Main Street) later this winter...get ready Mesa! to enjoy Novel's excellent ice cream.

Absolutely amazing! The flavors are all so unique and delicious and they are more than encouraging of you sampling any flavors you're interested in. The girl behind the counter was super cheerful and patient with us. The outdoor patio is a fun setup to enjoy your ice cream on as well. I am kicking myself for not getting here sooner!
Delicious! I recommend the French toast and the Big Poppa Tart. The staff was also fantastic! Whenever I come to Vegas again, this place will be a must!

Wow the biggest donut selection I have ever seen honestly. Nothing is labeled but if something looks good to you just ask what it is and they will tell you! I got the banana cream donut and ate it many hours later and it was still amazing so I bet if you get a donut fresh it is perfect!

The Crack Pie Ice cream is TO DIE FOR!!!! Crack pie is also very delicious as well. I've been a longtime IG follower and was pumped to hear that there was a MILK in Vegas back in April. Had a local take me to the money and spent a shit ton of $ on desserts for the 5 hours drive back to California. Best cookies to order in my opinion are the compost and cornflake-chocolate-chip-marshmallow cookie. I honest feel like the cornflake is the best. If you have a craving for corn, grab the cornbread cookie. First time I had it, it hit the spot... Second time around it kind of tasted different. Hoping that that was just the heat and alcohol causing the difference. When ordering the soft serve, do yourself a got damn favor and get the crack pie with cornflakes... That shit is FIRE! OVERALL - love this damn spot & they need to come to SoCal!!

Very basic pastries. We were very excited to try The Cake Boss bakery but it was disappointing. As I wrote in the review about his restaurant, due to his popularity they very busy and cater to quantity rather than quality. I've been to better bakeries, don't waste your time in the long lines or your money. My SO tried a cupcake and had the cannoli cheesecake, they are gluten free so no crust, my favorite part. I will not return. Overrated:-(

I feel like Milk Bar is the backup plan for people unwilling to wait in line for an hour for eggslut. I'm so glad we are those people. Milk bar has these little bagel pops that is just a bunch of cream cheese stuffed into a bagel roll. They also have drunky milk shakes and coffee (hair of the dog) that are surprisingly strong and can get a good morning buzz going. Don't judge, it's Vegas! We went back twice because they get people through the line quickly, and their drinks and treats are tasty. The staff was really friendly too, which is something that is not always easy to find in this city.
SINfully delicious!! Amazing flavor combinations that you would not expect in a donut, but they work!

Disappointed is my word for this location. I have visited the Fort Lauderdale location twice and have walked away raving about the food. When I saw that Las Vegas had a shop, I was giddy!! We took our, who was a first timer, into the shop as well and told her about all the yummy options!! I didn't want too much so I ordered 2 scoops of Cookie Monster with hot fudge. The server seemed to not understand my order but finally got it straight. It wasn't bad. For $8.99, it should be amazing, right? My friend ordered a chocolate milkshake. Again, a different server seemed to be lost on what to do. In the times of today where lots of places are short on help, I wasn't surprised. She also asked for whipped cream, which is an added charge. This shake took 5 minutes to make. Not sure why. And her whipped cream wasn't on it. She said something about it didn't taste right. We couldn't figure out what. My husband ordered the cookies with ice cream. It's our most favorite thing. He was extremely disappointed. The cookies were really hard and didn't taste fresh. The store was busy but the employees seemed off. There wasn't a lot of communication and the whole visit was just not what we had hoped. It felt messy in there. I would return to the FL location again but not this one.

Crack Pie, I LOVE YOU! You were definitely addicting. Cookies, check! Cereal Milk, its milk that tastes like cereal. So its a win as well. If someone wants to murder me, please just bury me alive under all of Milk Bar's offerings because it's that good

I get my nails done in the same complex- LOVE them! I used to work across the street. Today I decided to have my nails done. The etching on the window says " coffee and tea". I order a cookie and a tea. The girl behind the counter is super flustered and stares at me "we don't serve tea here" why the heck do you have someone etch "tea" on your front window when you don't sell it??? Super lame!!

Too many sweets to choose from! I got a pleasant surprise today when the other half showed up with a bag from this bake shop! I've been sick & feeling crabby so this did the trick! To my surprise he got a lot of incredible goodies! Brownies that are so moist and come with a thick layer of fudge! A beautiful tiramisu that almost looks to good to break into. A vanilla cupcake because I'm obsessed with plain ones. A cream puff filled with decadent custard! Macaroons, a Nutella cookie, black & white cookies & chocolate covered strawberries! Talk about a way to a girls heart! I have no idea how we're going to eat all this stuff but we'll give it a good try! Everything I've ever tasted from this place has been great. Be prepared because it's very pricey but the quality is there.

The ice cream is good, the dough is amazing, but Brandon is the BEST ice cream shop owner. My husband and I couldn't stop talking about what an awesome experience we got out of buying ice-cream. Brandon is so passionate and patient and made us feel very welcomed and definitely wanna come back! Don't miss this place as I'm sure you will feel the same way and come back and write a 5-star review :)

It was around 10:30 pm so perhaps the crowds where gone. I mean there was a little line but it went fast. Bought a regular Cannoli, an individual chocolate mousse, an eclair and an individual dark chocolate mousse. So the dark was tasty. The eclair was fluffy and light, and the chocolate mousse was alright. The Cannoli not so much. Then again never was a big fan.

Do not order the pizza. If your idea of pizza us bread with cheese and sauce of it, then you might enjoy it. I has the pepperoni sausage. It had one piece of sausage. In my opinion, if you want pizza, you would be better to get one from 711 or a frozen one from the grocery store. However, the desserts look fabulous. It did not try any. If you want coffee/esoresso and a biscotti or other dessert then this is probably a great place.

As a European Expat living in Charlotte, I can tell you this isn't a French bakery, not even close!!! It is Southern standards which mean it is sweet sweet sweet and nothing else! Bleugh! Don't waste your time or money on eating nothing but sugar.... Dumpy atmosphere as well.

As I walked up to the window, the concrete floors were swept, and the stainless-steel countertops were, pun intended, stainless. The red, white, and blue color scheme occupied my line of sight.
